User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:6.0a1) Gecko/20110413 Firefox/6.0a1 Build Identifier: 6.0a1 (ubuntu nightlies) Problem on Firefox 4+ for linux and windows. The li items below an ol set to display inline don't increment -- they are numbered 1,1,1,1. Firefox 3.6 or Webkit number normally.
  1. hi
  2. hi
  3. hi
  4. hi
Reproducible: Always Steps to Reproduce: 1. make an ol 2. set it to dislay inline 3. add more than one child li Actual Results: lis are numbered 1,1,1,1 Expected Results: li numbers should increment Most ol lists are display block, but there are styling and other cases where the display value must be set to inline while remaining semantically a numbered list. Numbering should still work.

comments.raw_text: The problem is that we switched from having a single wrapper block for all the <li>s to having separate wrappers for each one (because there is space between them; just eliminating the spaces brings back the old behavior).
comments.text: The problem is that we switched from having a single wrapper block for all the <li>s to having separate wrappers for each one (because there is space between them; just eliminating the spaces brings back the old behavior).

comments.raw_text: So I think the best fix here is to just not treat the anonymous block as a counter scope, but then the numbering will be 0,0,0,0 due to bug 4522....
